intro: Gustavia corymbosa, commonly known as the white hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are ovate and have a smooth texture, while its flowers have five petals and a prominent central stamen. Gustavia corymbosa is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens and as a houseplant.
